Got it — here’s the same list but annotated with the Chinese names so you can recognize them easily when visiting Dongguan with your family:

Great Family-Friendly Destinations in Dongguan (东莞)

1. Yinxian Resort (隐贤山庄 / Yinxian Shanzhuang) Often called a mini Disneyland in Dongguan. Includes glass bridge, water park, small zoo, playgrounds, live shows, and the night “Butterfly Shadow” water-light show. 👉 隐贤山庄

2. Dongguan Xiangshi Zoo (香市动物园 / Xiangshi Dongwuyuan) Well-loved family zoo with elephants, sea lions, and rare animals. Highly rated for families with children. 👉 香市动物园

3. Nanshe Ming and Qing Ancient Village (南社明清古村落 / Nanshe Mingqing Gucunluo) A preserved Ming–Qing era village with old houses, alleys, and courtyards. Relaxed pace, nice cultural outing. 👉 南社明清古村落

4. Songshan Lake Park (松山湖风景区 / Songshanhu Fengjingqu) & Qifeng Park (旗峰公园 / Qifeng Gongyuan) Large green parks perfect for family walks, picnics, and kids running around. 👉 松山湖风景区、旗峰公园

5. Keyuan Garden (可园 / Keyuan) One of the famous four gardens of Guangdong, a classical Lingnan garden with pavilions, ponds, and rockery. 👉 可园

6. Centennial Chinese Comic Art Museum (百年漫画馆 / Bainian Manhuaguan) & Senhui Natural History Museum (森晖自然博物馆 / Senhui Ziran Bowuguan)

  • 百年漫画馆: Fun for kids with comic art exhibitions.
  • 森晖自然博物馆: Fossils and interactive natural history displays. 👉 百年漫画馆、森晖自然博物馆

Suggested Itinerary Snapshot

  • Morning: 隐贤山庄 (Yinxian Resort) — rides, shows, zoo.
  • Lunch & Rest: Local Changping Town (常平镇) eateries.
  • Afternoon: 香市动物园 (Xiangshi Zoo) for animal shows, or 可园 (Keyuan Garden) for calm cultural stroll.
  • Evening: 南社明清古村落 (Nanshe Ancient Village) for a cultural walk, or 松山湖 (Songshan Lake) for open-air relaxation.
  • Rainy/Indoor: 百年漫画馆 (Comic Art Museum) or 森晖自然博物馆 (Natural History Museum).

Do you also want me to map these onto your mentioned ones (东江印象园, 汇一城, 东莞老街) and suggest whether they’re better for adults, kids, or both? That way you’ll know how to balance local culture with family fun.
